entry.title: How to Use an Attribute from One Model to Populate a Dimension in Another Model via Data Action (SAC
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m working with two planning models in SAP Analytics Cloud: Model A (FIN_COSTPLANNING) contains the dimension CostCenter, which has an attribute called DepartmentGroup_Assignment. Model B (HR_RESOURCEPLANNING) includes both CostCenter and DepartmentGroup as separate dimensions.

My goal is to create a Data Action in Model B that uses the CostCenter as a link to bring in the corresponding DepartmentGroup (originally stored as an attribute in Model A) and write it into the DepartmentGroup dimension in Model B.

Since attributes cannot be directly referenced in advanced formulas, I’m unsure how to best implement this logic across models. 

What is the recommended solution to achieve this?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Can SAC work like power pivot from Excel?
entry.content:
Gurus,

  I came across this very basic issue in SAC just trying things around: Table A has customer ID and sales, Table B has customer ID and customer region. I just wanted to make a graph of sales by region by linking dimension customer ID in the 2 tables. However after linking i could not make the graph because SAC gave me this error message: 'For the ewidget to render, you need to add a linked dimension between the primary model and the secondary model.'

  The whole point of linking dimension to me is to do power pivoting similar to that in Excel. If i have to add the linked dimension there is no point of making the graph. What am I missing here? Thank you!

entry.title: Performance improvements in SAC Story Building
entry.content:
🚀 Speed vs. Features in SAP SAC?

Some features in SAP Analytics Cloud make stories "shine" ✨—others just slow them down 🐢.  I’ve seen both, and it made me wonder…

In our SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) stories, we wanted to automatically set the date input to the previous month when the story opens. Since SAC doesn’t support customer exit variables like in traditional SAP BW reports, we solved it using a script in the onInitialization event.

This script runs as soon as the story opens and sets the input control to the previous month based on the current date.

Here's the script with step-by-step comments:

// Get the current date and time
var cur_date = new Date(Date.now());

// Extract the current year and month
var jahr = cur_date.getFullYear();  // e.g., 2025
var monat = cur_date.getMonth();    // January = 0, December = 11

// If the current month is January (0), go to December of the previous year
if (monat === 0) {
    monat = 12;
    jahr = jahr - 1;
}

// Create a CalendarDateTime object for the previous month
// Note: month must be 1-based (January = 1, not 0 as cur_date.getMonth() hands it over)
var calenderYearCCD = CurrentDateTime.createCalendarDateTime({
    granularity: CalendarTimeGranularity.Month,
    year: jahr,
    month: monat
});

// Set the application's current date/time filter to the calculated month
Application.setCurrentDateTime(calenderYearCCD);

Current Date Input Control for dynamic date range setting of all widgets:

 

🛠️ What We Tested to Improve Performance

To support our dynamic date script and reduce load times, we experimented with several SAC story features to see how they affect performance:

  • 🔁 Widget Data Refresh Options – e.g. refresh active widgets only

  • 👁️ Initial Widget Visibility – showing all widgets by sizing them accordingly

This script is used in onActive, the Panels are set to 1/10 the size they should be, so the user sees all widgets on the story when she opens the story. This had a huge impact on loading times. because otherwise as soon as she starts scrolling, the widgets that have not been loaded yet start loading which weirdly can take even more time then loading everything together.

var AllShrinkPanels = [Panel_64, Panel_78, Panel_67, Panel_79, Panel_80, Panel_81, Panel_82, Panel_83, Panel_84, Panel_85, Panel_86, Panel_87];


for (var w = 0;w<AllShrinkPanels.length;w++){
	AllShrinkPanels[w].getLayout().setWidth(AllShrinkPanels[w].getLayout().getWidth().numberValue * 10);

  • 🔗 Linked Dimensions – Astonishingly this alone was not an issue

  • 🧭 Filters Across Linked Models – As long as all filters are created based on the same model, there was no serious performance issue (but using dimensions from another model was.

  • ➕ Sums in Tables – huge impact on loading times

  • 🎨 Conditional Formatting – looks great, marginally hurts performance

  • 🔄 Linked Analysis Across Models – convenient but can be a bottleneck, if key dimension is not included in other model so it has to join twice to get a result.

⚠️ Disclaimer: Our tests were done using fairly large datasets, so the performance impact may vary with smaller or simpler data models.

💬 What’s your take?

Which SAC features help or hurt performance in your experience? Let’s share tips and horror stories.👇

entry.title: SAC Live Connection to CDS Entity
entry.content:
Has anyone tried using a CDS Entity as a source to a SAC story using a Live connection?

The earlier definition of 'define view' with '@Analytics: { query: true }' annotation works fine. I am able to browse and find the 2C<sqlViewName> in SAC.

But when I use the 'define view entity' with '@Analytics: { query: true }' annotation, I am able to see the 2C<CDSviewName> in RSRT, but it does not show up in SAC.

I couldn't find much information on CDS entity as a source to SAC. Has anyone tried using CDS entity in SAC?

entry.title: Set Custom Story as Default Landing Page in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I would like to know if it is possible to change the default landing page in SAP Analytics Cloud when a user logs in (as an end user).
Specifically, instead of opening the default "Today" page, I want the system to automatically open a specific Story page that I created.

Is this possible?
If so, how can it be configured?

Thank you!

 
Ask ChatGPT

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud Optimized Story Experience API Reference Guide
entry.content:
I have the following problem: I want to get a notification in my story both in the SAC and by mail when I click on a button (function onclick() ).

Here is my code:

 

var user_info = Application.getUserInfo();
console.log(user_info);
 
console.log("Senden beginnen:");
Application.sendNotification({
    "title": "Test",
    "content": "Test2",
    "receivers": [Application.getUserInfo().id],
    "isSendEmail": false
 
}
);
console.log("Senden beendet:");
 
I also have the appropriate authorizations (Runtime notification). Unfortunately, I still don't get a notification and the following exception is thrown in the JS code.

KR

Dominik

I am trying to import exchange rates from S/4HANA to SAC, but there is no standard CDS view available for this purpose. Therefore, I am attempting to import them from SAP BW. However, I cannot find a suitable query in SAP BW either. Could someone please let me know how to get exchange rates from SAP BW to SAC?

entry.title: Facing issues with shown data in SAC
entry.content:
Dear all

We have problems with newly created users that no data is displayed.

We use the SAC with a live data connection to a BW 7.5. Existing users can evaluate the stories in the SAC as usual.
New users can also open the stories, but no data is displayed.
The necessary roles and teams in the SAC are assigned.
When I execute the BW query via transaction rsudo for these users, results are also displayed.
So I suspect that the problem lies in the SAC.

Could this be related to the new RateRoles? Or are such problems generally known since QRC2/2025?

Thank you and best regards
Stefan

entry.title: SAC Data Point Comment - Keeping Comments when Changing Data Context
entry.content:
Hi Everyone, 

Is there any way to keep data point comments even if the data context is changed?

We have a table as below and we would like to link the comments to specific dimensions only (in this case Products, Plants, Countries).
So, the rest of the dimensions (Dimension A, Dimension B etc.) could be removed from the table or replaced with another dimensions. But the comments should be still visible as the specific dimensions are in the table.

ProductsPlantsCountriesDimension ADimension BSales QtyComment
Product A Plant ATurkeyCategory ASupplier A200Sales Qty is low due to high prices.
Product B Plant BGermanyCategory BSupplier B300 
Product C Plant CUSACategory CSupplier C400 

Therefore, the comments should only be related to key characteristics (e.g. product, plant, country) and not to the whole table structure.

Is there any way to achieve this workaround via SAC Scripting?

Thanks,
Onur

entry.title: SAC | Linked Variables | Filtering on chart with two BW live models not working properly
entry.content:
Dear all,

I’m currently working on a story in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) where I’ve combined two models for use in a single chart. Both models are linked via the dimension “cal/month” and a corresponding story variable.

The challenge I’m facing is that updates to the story variable are not consistently reflected in the chart that uses both models. While the variable change correctly impacts separate charts based on individual models, it fails to update the blended chart after the initial refresh. Interestingly, the first change to the variable after refreshing the story does work—but subsequent changes only affect charts that are not using linked queries.

Data Source: SAP BW Live Connection

First Refresh:

 

Second Refresh:

 

Linking settings:

 

Chart Design

I’ve seen a similar issue raised in the SAP Community, though no resolution was provided. This raises the question: is this a known limitation, or could it be a product bug?

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/linked-variables-as-story-filter-not-working-correctly/qaq-p/12179295

Best

entry.title: Data Action : Allocating cost per customer based on their Area.
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I need help in allocating cost per customer based on their Area based on same company code, plant and profitcenter.

I have two models:

  • Cost Model (Source):
    Dimensions: Company Code, GL Account, Cost Center, Plant, Profit Center
    Measure: Amount

  • Revenue Model (Driver):
    Dimensions: Company Code, Cost Center, Plant, Profit Center, Customer
    Measure: Area

I want to allocate the Amount from the Cost Model to customers using the Area from the Revenue Model as the driver. The allocation should be proportional based on Area.

The final output should assign each cost line item from the Cost Model (identified by Company Code, GL Account, Cost Center, Plant, and Profit Center) to one or more Customers, such that the total Amount is fully distributed across customers based on their share of the Area within the same dimensional intersection (Company Code, Cost Center, Plant, and Profit Center).

My input data : Cost Model

Revenue Model : 

After Allocation , I want each customer which is K1 to K4 should repeat for each GL account G1 and G2 and than , the Allocated cost should be calculated as

Allocation Logic

  • For each GL Account (e.g., G1 and G2), and for each Customer (K1 to K4):
    • Allocate cost proportionally based on Area.
    • Formula:

Allocated Cost= Amount× Area / Sum of Area​

 

Desired O/p: Final Output I am expecting

Can you please let me know how we can do it using Data Action in SAP Analytics cloud. 

 

@N1kh1l  : Can you please share your expert advice on this as well ?.

entry.title: SAC Advanced Formula Iterative Prioritization
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I need some suggestion and perspective advise on below calculation logic.

We have some car plate codes ( VLK_PRJ ) and each plate code has relavant customer code assigned in its masterdata as well as contract starting date. As the first step, I generate mapping combination with VLK_PRJ, Date ( Contract starting date ), and relavant customer code ( VLK_CUS ) and entrytype ( VLK_ETYPE ) as I_MAPPING which means mapping coming from integration.

Then, those values are shown to users, and they might enter some adjustments for customer assignments ( assuming the car will be given service to another customer in the future ). I keep those entries with entrytype A_MAPPING ( adjusted mapping ).

What I want to achieve is creating C_MAPPING records ( calculated mapping ) starting from the contract starting date until the end of planning date coming from version attribute. For this calculation I have below rules. Also, I have 21 customer in masterdata, and around 450 plate codes.

  1. If both A_MAPPING and I_MAPPING exists with the same combination of VLK_PRJ and Date, then I_MAPPING is ignored.
  2. If multiple combinations are entered for the same combination of VLK_PRJ and date, then the first customer code will be used, rest will not be considered. ( I know this might be handled from input screen, but let's assume user entered multiple combination by mistake )
  3. If there is no mapping entry for the further periods ( I_MAPPING only exists for the starting date, and no A_MAPPING is entered for the next period ), then duplicate it from preivous period as it is.

Please find below script which works as expected but it takes more than 3 mins which is too long I believe. I have 3 blocks of calculations, improvements or different approach for any part is appreciated.

CONFIG.GENERATE_UNBOOKED_DATA = OFF

MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = "SDATA"
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/START] TO [d/Version].[p/END]
MEMBERSET [d/VLK_ETYPE] = ("A_MAPPING", "C_MAPPING", "I_MAPPING")
MEMBERSET [d/VLK_PRJ] = BASEMEMBER([d/VLK_PRJ], "PLAKA_AKTIF")

AGGREGATE_DIMENSIONS = [d/VLK_DET], [d/VLK_PCTR]
AGGREGATE_WRITETO [d/VLK_DET] = "#"
AGGREGATE_WRITETO [d/VLK_PCTR] = "#"

VARIABLEMEMBER #MAPPING_FLAG OF [d/VLK_ETYPE]

INTEGER @LV_CHECK
INTEGER @LV_COUNTER
INTEGER @i
INTEGER @LV_PREV_MONTH

DELETE([d/VLK_ETYPE] = "C_MAPPING") //clear previously calculated mapping

IF [d/VLK_ETYPE] = "A_MAPPING" THEN //mapping adjustments
	FOREACH.BOOKED [d/VLK_PRJ], [d/Date]
		FOREACH.BOOKED [d/VLK_CUS] ASC
			DATA([d/VLK_ETYPE] = "C_MAPPING") = RESULTLOOKUP() //only apply the first customer if multiple adjustments are entered for the same project time combination
			BREAK //do not proceed further
		ENDFOR
	ENDFOR

ENDIF

IF [d/VLK_ETYPE] = "I_MAPPING" THEN // mapping values coming from integration
	FOREACH.BOOKED [d/VLK_PRJ], [d/Date]

		@LV_CHECK = 0 // not sure if necessary ?
		@LV_CHECK = RESULTLOOKUP([d/VLK_ETYPE] = "A_MAPPING") // check if there is an adjustment entry
		IF @LV_CHECK = 0 THEN // if there is no adjustment entry
			DATA([d/VLK_ETYPE] = "C_MAPPING") = RESULTLOOKUP() // get whatever is coming from integration ( only 1 customer mapping is coming already from integration )
		ENDIF
	ENDFOR
ENDIF

IF [d/VLK_ETYPE] = "C_MAPPING" THEN // output mapping entrytype
	FOREACH.BOOKED [d/VLK_PRJ], [d/Date] ASC //start from the first month of mapping entry of the project
		
		// if no mapping is processed before, process further.
		IF RESULTLOOKUP([d/VLK_ETYPE] = #MAPPING_FLAG, [d/Date] = "000000", [d/VLK_CUS] = "#") = NULL THEN 
			DATA([d/VLK_ETYPE] = #MAPPING_FLAG, [d/Date] = "000000", [d/VLK_CUS] = "#") = 1 // flag mapping as processed for the project

			@LV_COUNTER = DATEDIFF([d/Date], [d/Version].[p/END], "MONTH")
			IF @LV_COUNTER > 0 THEN //check if not at the last month already
				FOR @I = 1 TO @LV_COUNTER  // start from the next month
					@LV_CHECK = 0 // not sure if necessary ?
					@LV_CHECK = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Date] = NEXT(@I, "MONTH", [d/Date])) // check if there is mapping entry for the next month
					IF @LV_CHECK = 0 THEN //if there is no mapping for the next month, get it from previous month
						
						@LV_PREV_MONTH = @I - 1
						DATA([d/Date] = NEXT(@I, "MONTH", [d/Date])) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Date] = NEXT(@LV_PREV_MONTH, "MONTH", [d/Date]))

					ENDIF
				ENDFOR
			ENDIF
		ENDIF
	ENDFOR
ENDIF

Thanks,

Volkan

entry.title: Delete Master Data Members Script
entry.content:

I want to delete Master Data members of dimension "Cost_Center" if property "DELETE" = "" (empty)

I have marked members with "N" in "DELETE" property that shouldn't be deleted.

Any ideas how to achieve this via script (I am not so strong in Javascript)? So first save all members in a variable where property "DELETE" is empty and then use the deleteMembers() function. I have tried var members = PlanningModel_1.getMembers("COST_CENTER"); however, I am unsure how to loop over where the property is empty.

@N1kh1l ?

Best regards

entry.title: SAC: issue with new builder experience in story design
entry.content:
hello all!

after update Q3-2025 in early release tenant, we tried to create some stories with the new builder experience. we found out that when creating a story through chrome browser we cannot add a filter in the story and we get the error:

 

[FailedAction - Action: store.createInstance@[{"app":"MAIN_APPLICATION"},{"story":"storyID"},{"table2":"92680339-4178-4606-9781-276892589378"},{"memberSelectorDialog":"MemberSelectorDialog"}] - Error: Store.CanNotRecreateInstance/Cannot create [{"app":"MAIN_APPLICATION"},{"story":"storyID"},{"table2":"92680339-4178-4606-9781-276892589378"},{"memberSelectorDialog":"MemberSelectorDialog"}], instance already exists.]
Correlation ID: 3109125650744680b648262069645231
 
if we create the same story through edge browser this error does not occur. 
Is it something new? should we use only edge from now on?
thanks
thomas

entry.title: SAP Analytic Cloud has really limited functionalities. Am I using it correctly?
entry.content:
Hey gurus,
supposedly this is SAP's product to compete against tableau or power bi

  • Linked dimension has to be in the graph or widget not working, so it's extremely limited compared to power pivot which can be sliced however you want as long as there's a linked dimension.

For example if i have a table with sales and customer ID and another table with customer ID and customer region. Power pivot can easily do a graph of sales by customer region as long as customer ID fields are linked. Whereas in SAC, the linked dimension which is the customer ID has to stay in the graph or it renders error. but what's the point of linked dimension havng to be in the graph to make it work? the whole point of linking to me is establishing relationship so that I can explor the data in differe ways.

  • No good way to do calculations easily, eg if sales is a measure, it doesn’t seem possible to do counts/sum/avg at the same time or to do filtering by criteria(sales > 100$). If it’s dimension, sum is not possible. The dimension to measure function can only do count/avg.
  • Data models not working in stories only working if I go to data analyzer and do ad hoc.

entry.title: CopyStep using Advanced Formula Step
entry.content:

Our goal is to copy data from the Actuals version (months 1 to 6) to the Planning version, and data from months 7 to 12 from the Forecast version to the Planning version.

We created the following parameters:

It is only possible to achieve this result through an advanced formula step. Does anyone have any suggestions?
